item.title: Israel Refuses to Renew Visa of Top UN Humanitarian Official for Gaza
item.description: The head of the agency that helps oversee international aid deliveries to the territory had criticized the impact of Israeli policy on civilians.

item.title: 2 Deadly Shootings in 2 Days Highlight Israel’s Failure to Address Gaza’s Power Vacuum
item.description: Over the weekend, Israeli soldiers shot Palestinians near an Israeli-backed aid site and a U.N. convoy. Both episodes pointed to Israel’s refusal to a...

item.title: SkyWest Flight Aborts Landing to Avoid Midair Collision Near Military Base
item.description: After the passenger jet landed safely in North Dakota, the pilot told passengers that he had made an “aggressive maneuver” to avoid hitting a military...

item.title: Seabed-Mining Firm Faces Legal Questions Over Trump Policy
item.description: After Trump pledged to open international waters to mining, The Metals Company sought U.S. permits. But other countries are raising legal concerns.

item.title: Did Jeju Air Pilots Shut Down Wrong Engine Before Deadly Crash?
item.description: Investigators found the Jeju Air flight crash-landed with only its badly damaged right engine on, but experts warned against drawing early conclusions...
